metadata.dc:author: Idrovo, Alvaro J
Silva, Elizabeth
Ortiz, Jaime E
Romero, William M
Villamil de García, Gladys
metadata.dc:description: Mercury is useful as a tracer of environmental pollution levels. We measured mercury levels in hair from two human mummies (XII and XIV centuries, respectively) and from a stag (Odocoileus virginianus). The total and inorganic mercury levels found in the samples were very low. This findings indicated a minimal exposure to mercury in food and its absence in the atmosphere. Mercury levels can be used to explore the relationship between humans and environment, especially after metallurgy appeared, and to assess environmental contamination in different periods.
metadata.dc:title: Determinación de mercurio en muestras biológicas prehispánicas colombianas: primeras experiencias y perspectivas de investigación.
[Mercury determination in prehispanic Colombian biological samples: first experiences and investigation perspectives].
metadata.dc:publisher: Biomedica : revista del Instituto Nacional de Salud
